column4: Hello everyone. I've  been struggling with an application that uses java. It has my CPU at 100% most of the time. I've read countless forum posts regarding this topic. Does anyone know of a java stress test that could confirm whether or not my java instalation is defective?
do you run openjava or the sun edition?
that JVM is fine and should work.
is pidgin totally broken in interpid? it seg-faults instandly ...
is there a chance that I might have misconfigued something or could it just be the application that is at fault ?
it should be the application, unless you did something very strange. You never deleted stuff from /usr/lib/jvm ?
all I did was install java, perhaps install other java packages by mistake, but that is all.
is this a java applet or the standalone java program ?
that thing is evil, it probes the network via JNI. Yes, that can cause 100% load.

haha, nice definition. I tried to keep in mind that it itself would use alot of recources depending on traffic, but since we also use Untangle ( web filter that runs on java) and barely uses 50% cpu, I was skeptic.  Ubuntu stops responding after a few days if I leave that app running non stop.
you can try to increase the jvm-ram: java -Xms1000M -Xmx1000M .... But i don't think it will work form more then one week.

ok, I'll see if that works. Thanks alot for your time. Do you by any chance know of another application other than that netprobe that might do a better job and not consume as much recources by any chance ?
i don't need to know what is going over our network, so no.
ok, thanks for the help though.
